urls.title: Environment Agency launches educational tools for WOD to ‚Äòhelp marine life thrive‚Äô - Preventing Plastic Pollution
urls.description: Schools across England will mark World Ocean Day (WOD) next month (Tuesday, June 8) by exploring the journey of plastic with the Environment Agency. Primary and secondary schools are invited to view a series of online films and activities via an interactive map in advance of the event, culminating in a live question and answer sessio n with Environment Agency and World Wildlife Fund experts on the actual day. By clicking on different points of the map, students can learn how plastic pollution travels

tweets.text:
Ahead of #WorldOceanDay, we've developed an interactive tool for primary and secondary school students to show how plastic pollution travels to the ocean.

If you're a teacher, parent or guardian, read more here:
https://t.co/YvPDT5eR45 

@Plastic_EU #STEMEducation https://t.co/aU627GeQJx

urls.title: Movements of common bream Abramis brama in a highly connected, lowland wetland reveal sub‚Äêpopulations with diverse migration strategies
urls.description: Studies suggest the migratory behaviours of potamodromous fishes can be highly variable in barrier-free systems, where differing movement types enable populations to exploit a wide range of food a...

urls.title: Acoustic telemetry reveals strong spatial preferences and mixing during successive spawning periods in a partially migratory common bream population
urls.description: Partial migration, whereby a population comprises multiple behavioural phenotypes that each have varying tendencies to migrate, is common among many animals. Determining the mechanisms by which these phenotypes are maintained is important for understanding their roles in population structure and stability. The aim here was to test for the temporal and spatial consistency of migratory phenotypes in a common bream Abramis brama (‚Äòbream‚Äô) population, and then determine their social preferences and extent of mixing across three successive annual spawning periods. The study applied passive acoustic telemetry to track the movements of bream in the River Bure system of the Norfolk Broads, a lowland wetland comprising highly connected riverine and lacustrine habitats. Analyses revealed that individual migratory phenotype was highly consistent across the 3 years, but this was not predicted by fish sex or length at tagging. During the annual spawning periods, network analyses identified off-chan

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids BTW, three illegal waste loads per week have been turned away while the operators knew you were watching. How many hundreds more are already in the ground? Why haven't you entered Red Industries' premises to look at their records? Why no samples? Why no action?

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids Sorry, but you challenged them to reduce the pollution (stop referring to it as odour) by 30 April. The situation hasn't changed one bit. Stop challenging. Start prosecuting. Close it down. Cap it off.

@EnvAgencyMids What specifically are the actions your are challenging @RedIndustries2 to undertake?What are the success measures?It‚Äôs out of control,devoid of leadership @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA & now an administrative nightmare you are happy to let this carry on @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/k2nmP0X9li
@EnvAgencyMids Not working though is it whatever your doing CAP IT OFF AND GET SOMEONE IN TO REGULATE AND RESTORE IT LEGALLY AND PROPERLY!!!!!

@pow_rebecca good morning. It is 5.15am and I am preparing for another day of facing people suffering with breathing difficulties, and the poisonous stench when I woke up is unbearable. Hope you have have a nice day breathing fresh air.
